FuncDef: The set multicast-nat bind command fast switches the binding between a multicast NAT outbound group and multicast NAT instance group in the multicast NAT binding view.
CLIs: set multicast-nat outbound-group-id <outbound-group-id-value> bind instance-group-id <instance-group-id-value> [ clean-switch [ first-field | second-field ] ] fast-mode

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a multicast NAT instance group.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4000.

Sets the switching mode of multicast groups to clean switching.
-

Sets the first field for multicast group switching.
-

Sets the second field for multicast group switching.
-

Sets the switching mode of multicast groups to fast switching.
-

Specifies the ID of a multicast NAT outbound group.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4000.

Examples: [~HUAWEI-GigabitEthernet1/0/1] multicast-nat outbound id 1 name out1 src-mac auto-translate src-ip 10.0.0.1 dst-ip 225.0.0.1 dst-udp-port 100
[*HUAWEI-GigabitEthernet1/0/1] multicast-nat outbound id 2 name out2 src-mac auto-translate src-ip 10.0.0.1 dst-ip 225.0.0.2 dst-udp-port 101
[~HUAWEI-multicast-nat-bind-list] multicast-nat outbound-group id 1 name streamout1 bind instance id 1 name streamin1 switch-mode clean-switch switch-field first-field fast-mode
[~HUAWEI-multicast-nat-bind-list] set multicast-nat outbound-group-id 1 bind instance-group-id 2 clean-switch first-field fast-mode
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To fast switch the binding between a multicast NAT outbound group and multicast NAT instance group, run the set multicast nat group bind fast switch command in the multicast NAT binding view.
This command takes effect only when fast switching is configured for the binding between a multicast NAT outbound group and multicast NAT instance group. No configuration is generated in the configuration file.
